resources.string: Bangladesh – one of the world’s most densely populated countries – faces many challenges despite reducing poverty and violence in recent years.\n\n Potential sources of conflict still exist in the country, including political violence, corruption, gender-based violence, organised crime, political polarisation, low trust in security and justice institutions, and the growth of extremism.

Pakistan – one of the world’s most densely populated countries – faces many challenges despite reducing poverty and violence in recent years.\n\n Potential sources of conflict still exist in the country, including political violence, corruption, gender-based violence, organised crime, political polarisation, low trust in security and justice institutions, and the growth of extremism.

India – one of the world’s most densely populated countries – faces many challenges despite reducing poverty and violence in recent years.\n\n Potential sources of conflict still exist in the country, including political violence, corruption, gender-based violence, organised crime, political polarisation, low trust in security and justice institutions, and the growth of extremism.
